NDM_metadata.name: MPLS-TP OpenFlow Protocol Extensions for SPTN
doc: SPTN OpenFlow protocol EXtensions v.07.docx
Uses features beyond TTPv1.0
Bundles (ONF Extensions Pack 1), use optional
Table Synchronization (ONF Extensions Pack 1)
Output Port Metadata (ONF Extensions Pack 2)
Packet Registers (ONF Extensions Pack 2), Introduces PACKET_REGS(N) field.
Copy Field (ONF Extensions Pack 2)
All messages should be TLV for ease of extensibility
Added port description properties
Requires OpenFlow 1.4.
Egress Tables
Defined in OpenFlow 1.5
Can be used with 1.3.4 except for table features message extensions.
Used in group entries to override default OpenFlow IN_PORT forwarding restrictions.
See EXT-138
ifNum, 32-bit value. Physical ports in range 1..65535 (0x0000nnnn).
ifNum, 32-bit value. Logical ports > 65536
ifNum, any port
12-bit VLAN id value from header field.
OpenFlow sets bit 12 to indicate presence of the field.
Port VLAN id used for VLAN assignment.
OpenFlow sets bit 12 to indicate presence of the field.
Different ranges for different tunnel types.
(For VPWS,high 16 bits are 0x0001; For VPLS E-LAN, high 16 bits are 0x0002; For VPLS E-Tree, high 16 bits are 0x0003).
Non-tunnel packets from physical ports always have tunnel_id zero.
Any valid ethertype, which will be  >1536 (0x0600),
except for 0x8870 (jumbo frame)
VLAN header PCP field
VLAN header DEI field
index into a QoS table
Lmep id provides connection between OpenFlow and OF-Config domains.
Differentiate provider mdl when more than one openFlowMpId is mentioned in the actions.
Differentiate mip (customer mdl) when more than one openFlowMpId is mentioned in the actions.
Differentiate layer when more than one openFlowMpId is mentioned in the actions.
Differentiate layer when more than one openFlowMpId is mentioned in the actions.
Differentiate layer when more than one LMEP_Id is mentioned in the actions.
Differentiate interface mdlwhen more than one openFlowMpId is mentioned in the actions.
Y.1731 OAM frame maintenance level.
Virtual ingress port for MPLS packets.
Virtual ingress port for MPLS packets.
Indicates packet from UNI and identified by port+vlan:
For VPWS,high 16 bits are 0x0000; For VPLS E-LAN, high 16 bits are 0x0001;
For VPLS E-Tree root node,high 16 bits are 0x0101; For VPLS E-Tree leaf, high 16 bits are 0x0201).
Virtual ingress port for MPLS packets.
Indicates packet from NNI and identified by PW label(encap+decap):
For VPWS,high 16 bits are 0x0002; For VPLS E-LAN, high 16 bits are 0x0003).
For VPLS E-Tree root node,high 16 bits are 0x0103; For VPLS E-Tree leaf node, high 16 bits are 0x0203).
Virtual ingress port for MPLS packets.
Could be either local_mpls_l2_port or network_mpls_l2_port
A MAC address
Unicast MAC address of router.
Index into meter table.
Index into meter table.
Greater than 0xffff.
Index into a color actions table.
Pipeline metadata.
IPv4 Address - 32 bits represented as 4 decimal values - nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn
IPv6 Address - 128 bits represented as 8 groups of hex quartets - nnnn:nnnn:nnnn:nnnn:nnnn:nnnn:nnnn:nnnn
IP Header Protocol field.
IP Header DSCP field.
IP Header ECN field.
ICMP Header Type field value.
ICMP Header Code field value.
16-bit TCP, UDP, or SCTP port number
20-bit label - reserved values should be excluded
3-bit MPLS header TC field.
1: VPWS; Others Reserved.
Counter id for class and color based counters.
Y.1731 header opcode field.
Group Entry Identifier (see Name Format in Group Entry Types)
network group id for ingress mpls l2 port , used for VPLS split horizon (0:leaf:1:root; other values are reserved)
network group id for egress mpls l2 port, used for VPLS split horizon (0:leaf:1:root; other values are reserved)
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Increments MEP loss measurement Tx counter using current Traffic_Class value.
Requires openFlowMpId argument with value <mp_id> to identify the counters for the MEP.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Increments MEP loss measurement Rx counter using current Traffic_Class value
Requires openFlowMpId argument with value <mp_id> to identify the counters for the MEP.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Harvests loss measurement counters for a MEP by priority.
Requires openFlowMpId argument with value <mp_id> to identify counters for the MEP.
Priority is taken from the OAM LMR message.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Requires type and index arguments.
For LCK drop use type 0 and openFlowMpId index.
For 1+1 tail end use type 1 and drop_index from protection group configuration.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Sets MPLS_TC in PW shim header using current Traffic_Class and Color values
Invoked from an MPLS VPN group.
Requires index argument with value <qos_index> to specify entry
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Sets outer VLAN PCP for a PW using current Traffic_Class and Color values.
Invoked from an MPLS VPN group.
Requires index argument with value <qos_index> to specify entry
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Sets MPLS_TC field in LSP shim header using current Traffic_Class and Color values.
Invoked from an MPLS Tunnel group.
Requires index argument with value <qos_index> to specify entry
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Sets outer VLAN PCP for an LSP using current Traffic_Class and Color values
Invoked from an MPLS Tunnel group.
Requires index argument with value <qos_index> to specify entry
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Increments referenced Tx packet and byte counters for the current value of Traffic_Class.
Requires index argument with value <index> to identify a set of counters.
Action Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Increments referenced Tx packet and byte counters for the current value of Color.
Requires index argument with value <index> to identify a set of counters.
OpenFlow action defined in EXT-320.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.

Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Used for G.8113.1/Y.1732 OAM
Piepline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Used for G.8013/Y.1731 OAM
Header Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Used for G.8013/Y.1731 OAM
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Represents harvested loss measurement Tx counter value.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Represents harvested loss measurement Rx counter value.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.
Represents timestamp when performance measurement message received.
Pipeline Field used to identify whether a label is for the working or protection path.
Pipeline Field that identifies the output port in an egress table, defined in EXT-233.
Pipeline Field Identifier defined in SPTN OpenFlow Extensions.

flow_tables.name: Ingress Port
doc: First table in pipeline.
Decapsulated overlay packets processed by Bridging table.
Normal Ethernet packets processed by VLAN table.
Injected OAM frames processed by Injected OAM table.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Normal Ethernet
doc: Subscriber frame.
Fixed, cannot be modified or deleted.

built_in_flow_mods.name: OAM PDU Injection
doc: Treat as OAM PDU by default.
Fixed, cannot be modified or deleted.

flow_tables.name: Injected OAM
doc: Injected OAM frames are Y.1731 Ethernet.
MPLS-TP OAM frames output encapsulated and forwarded.

flow_mod_types.name: Ethernet Service Up MEP or MHF
doc: Inject into MPLS tunnel pipeline before forwarding and conditioning.
Used when need to count proactive PDUs at current level
openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: Ethernet Service Up MEP or MHF
doc: Inject into MPLS tunnel pipeline before forwarding and conditioning.
openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: Ethernet Service Down MEP or MHF
doc: Inject into UNI egress pipeline after conditioning.
Count in Egress Maintenance Point if LM enabled.
openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: Section
doc: Send to next hop.
Used when need to count proactive PDUs at current level
openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: Section
doc: Send to next hop.
openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: LSP MEP or MIP
doc: openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.
Used when need to count proactive PDUs at current level

flow_mod_types.name: LSP MEP or MIP
doc: openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV Type 1 or 3
doc: openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.
Used when need to count proactive PDUs at current level

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV Type 1 or 3
doc: openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV Type 4
doc: Used when need to count proactive PDUs at current level
openFlowMpid,, traffic class and color metadata with packet.
Push GAL then label.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV Type 4
doc: openFlowMpid, traffic class and color metadata with packet.
Push GAL then label.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Drop.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: VLAN
doc: Ingress VLAN Assignment and Translation.
If Ethernet Service MIP configured send frame to Ingress Maintenance Point.
Process two tags by assigning metadata, pop, go to VLAN 1 to process inner tag.

flow_mod_types.name: VLAN Filtering (NNI)
doc: Matches outer VLAN ID.

flow_mod_types.name: VLAN Assignment - Untagged  (Port VLAN Assignment - NNI)
doc: Port VLAN for untagged.
Pushes a VLAN tag with TPID 0x8100.
Sets outer VLAN.

flow_mod_types.name: VLAN Assignment -  Priority Tagged (Port VLAN Assignment - NNI)
doc: Port VLAN for priority tagged. Sets outer VLAN.

flow_mod_types.name: VLAN Allow All Tagged (NNI)
doc: Turns off VLAN filtering.
Only applies to tagged packets regardless of  VLAN

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS L2 Single Tag (UNI)
doc: MPLS match criteria - single tagged VLAN.
A port cannot have conflicting VLAN match and all traffic rules.
Next table is Ingress Maintenance Point if MEP or MIP configured.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS L2 Untagged (UNI)
doc: MPLS Match criteria untagged packet. Pushes and sets outer VLAN.
A port cannot have conflicting untagged VLAN match and all traffic rules.
Next table is Ingress Maintenance Point if MEP or MIP configured.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS L2  Priority Tagged (UNI)
doc: MPLS Match criteria priority tagged. Sets outer VLAN.
A port cannot have conflicting untagged VLAN match and all traffic rules.
Next table is Ingress Maintenance Point if MEP or MIP configured.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS L2 All Traffic on Port (UNI)
doc: MPLS - all traffic on port (VLAN match omitted, highest priority).
A port cannot have conflicting VLAN match and  all traffic rules.
Next table is Ingress Maintenance Point if MEP or MIP configured.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default drop rule, no VLAN for frame.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Ingress Maintenance Point
doc: Process packets for Ethernet Service OAM MIP or MEP from UNI.

flow_mod_types.name: Down MHF LBM Process (Client MDL)
doc: Configure MIP (LTM to local MAC) at this MDL.

flow_mod_types.name: Down MHF LTM Process (Client MDL)
doc: Configure MIP (LTR, destination MAC is Class 2 Multicast) at this MDL.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Process (our MDL)
doc: interface Down MEP.
Process all PDUs at specified MDL. PDU can be either Provider or Interface level.
Provider LM counts Interface PDUs.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Passthru - higher MDL
doc: Must be programmed to pass higher MDL PDUs for this user and treat as data.
MDL higher than provider, check for LCK and provider Tx count.
MDL higher than interface (generally level 0) interface Rx count.
Without these entries PDUs may be dropped unnecessarily.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Drop (lower MDL)
doc: Must be programmed to enable active filtering of lower MDL than provider -
(interface PDUs already processed in higher priority rule).
The optional output is so OAM engine can generate drop notification.

flow_mod_types.name: MEP Data
doc: For provider MEP optionally check for LCK and Tx Count.
For interface MEP optionally Rx count.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Not sure what to do with this packet, supposed to be a MIP or MEP here.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS L2 Port
doc: Represents ingress port for MPLS service flow from UNI.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS v4 DSCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPWS.
IPv4 DSCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS v6 DSCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPWS.
IPv6 DSCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: VPLS MPLS v4 DSCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPLS.
IPv4 DSCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: VPLS MPLS v6 DSCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPLS.
IPv6 DSCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS PCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPWS.
PCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: VPLS MPLS PCP
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPLS.
PCP simple classification.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPWS.
No QoS trust classification.

flow_mod_types.name: VPLS MPLS
doc: Fowarding decision required for VPLS.
No QoS trust classification.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default, skip simple classification.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS L2 Port DSCP Trust
doc: Classify traffic class and color based on IP DSCP field.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default on miss, pass through to MPLS QoS Classifier Table.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS L2 Port PCP Trust
doc: Classify traffic class and color based on VLAN PCP field.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default on miss, pass through to MPLS QoS Classifier Table.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS L2 Port QoS Class
doc: Classify traffic class and color based on complicated policies.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS-TP IPv4 MAC IP
doc: MAC, IPv4 and L4 combinations

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS-TP IPv6 IP
doc: IPv6 addresses only

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS-TP IPv4 IP
doc: IPv4 and L4 combinations (more efficient matching)

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS-TP MAC
doc: MAC addresses only (more efficient matching)

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default is to pass packet on.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Termination MAC
doc: Determine whether to bridge, route, or MPLS process a packet.
Bridge packet if MAC destination is other than local.
If local MAC then use ETH-TYPE to decide how to process.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS
doc: MPLS termination.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default on miss is to drop packet.
Fixed rule. Cannot be  modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS 0
doc: Match outermost MPLS label.
Used for three label processing scenarios.
Miss continues to MPLS 1.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label (no MEP)
doc: LSP terminate, ring or divert label.  No MEP on label.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label (MEP Data)
doc: LSP terminate, ring or divert label. Label has MEP with LM

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label (MEP Control)
doc: LSP terminate ring or divert label. Label has MEP, OAM Control PDU
Pop GAL label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame
Higher priority than non-OAM rule for this label, which must be installed first.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Built-in default on miss.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS 1
doc: First MPLS match table. Matches outermost MPLS shim header.
Contains superset of flow entries in MPLS 2
Updating MPLS 1 updates applicable flow entries in MPLS 2.
Flow entries that go to MPLS 2 are not synchronized.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label
doc: LSP termination. Action on next label.
This label does not have a MEP with LM enabled.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on this label (PHP)
doc: LSP termination. PHP so no maintenance point.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap Tunnel Label and forward based on this label
doc: LSP Swap. This label does not have a MIP.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap PW Label and forward based on this label
doc: PW Swap, like LSP swap but BOS. Used for MS-PW.
This label doess not have a MIP.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label (LSP MEP Data)
doc: LSP termination. Action on next label.
This label has a MEP with LM enabled and this is a data frame.
If Section MEP has LM enabled, can optionally match VLAN Id and count.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on next label (LSP MEP Control)
doc: LSP termination but  MEP on label and OAM PDU.
Pop GAL and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
If Section MEP has LM enabled, can optionally match VLAN Id and count.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap Tunnel Label (LSP OAM MIP Control)
doc: LSP swap with MIP on label and OAM PDU. No LM/DM on MIP.
Pop GAL and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame
If Section MEP has LM enabled, can optionally match VLAN Id and count.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap PW Label (MS-PW OAM MIP Control)
doc: PW MIP. No LM/DM at MIP, so no data action.
Higher priority than non-OAM rule for this label, which must be installed first.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.

flow_mod_types.name: L2 Switch  (PW Terminate)
doc: PW Terminate.
Group needs to be supplied if MPLS_TYPE is VPWS.
Optional actions if MEP with LM enabled.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 4 (PW Terminate OAM MEP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MEP OAM PDU.
OAM enabled, next label is GAL.
Pop PW and GAL, make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Only one  VCCV control rule for a label.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 1 (PW Terminate OAM MEP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MEP OAM PDU.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Only one  VCCV control rule per label.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 3 (OAM MIP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MIP control packet.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Data rule must be installed first.
Only one  VCCV control rule per label.

flow_mod_types.name: Section OAM
doc: Section OAM - Match GAL

built_in_flow_mods.name: PW OAM Unexpected Control (default rule)
doc: PW Unexpected OAM (ACH control frame) - Drop
This event should be a notification
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default drop
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS 2
doc: Second MPLS match table. Matches outermost label after pop.
Applicable flow entries updated with MPLS 1.
Flow entries that go to MPLS 2 are not applicable.

flow_mod_types.name: Pop Tunnel Label and forward based on this label (PHP)
doc: LSP termination. PHP so no maintenance point.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap Tunnel Label and forward based on this label
doc: LSP Swap. This label does not have a MIP.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap PW Label and forward based on this label
doc: PW Swap, like LSP swap but BOS. Used for MS-PW.
This label doess not have a MIP.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap Tunnel Label (LSP OAM MIP Control)
doc: LSP swap with MIP on label and OAM PDU. No LM/DM on MIP.
Pop GAL and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame
If Section MEP has LM enabled, can optionally match VLAN Id and count.

flow_mod_types.name: Swap PW Label (MS-PW OAM MIP Control)
doc: PW MIP. No LM/DM at MIP, so no data action.
Higher priority than non-OAM rule for this label, which must be installed first.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.

flow_mod_types.name: L2 Switch  (PW Terminate)
doc: PW Terminate.
Group needs to be supplied if MPLS_TYPE is VPWS.
Optional actions if MEP with LM enabled.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 4 (PW Terminate OAM MEP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MEP OAM PDU.
OAM enabled, next label is GAL.
Pop PW and GAL, make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Only one  VCCV control rule for a label.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 1 (PW Terminate OAM MEP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MEP OAM PDU.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Only one  VCCV control rule per label.

flow_mod_types.name: PW VCCV 3 (OAM MIP Control)
doc: PW Terminate for MIP control packet.
Pop PW label and make packet look like an Ethernet OAM frame.
Data rule must be installed first.
Only one  VCCV control rule per label.

flow_mod_types.name: Section OAM
doc: Section OAM - Match GAL

built_in_flow_mods.name: PW OAM Unexpected Control (default rule)
doc: PW Unexpected OAM (ACH control frame) - Drop
This event should be a notification
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default drop
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS Label Trust
doc: Classify traffic class and color based on MPLS_TC field.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS-TP Trust
doc: Set Traffic Class and Color.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default pass through.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS Type
doc: Goto table based on MPLS type pipeline field.

built_in_flow_mods.name: VPWS
doc: MPLS-TP VPWS, go to Policy ACL Table.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

built_in_flow_mods.name: VPLS
doc: MPLS-TP VPLS, go to Bridge Table.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default on miss, drop packet.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: MPLS-TP Maintenance Point
doc: Process OAM frame for G.8113.1 Down MEP or MIP.

flow_mod_types.name: MEP PDU Process
doc: ETH-TYPE is to satisfy OpenFlow prerequisite.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Default rule, built in.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: L2 Policer
doc: Per-service meters applied to Ethernet Service frames from UNI.

flow_mod_types.name: MPLS_L2_Port  Meter
doc: Must be a UNI-NNI flow (MPLS_L2_Port is local).
Meter index must be greater than 0xffff.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: L2 Policer Actions
doc: Actions based on packet color.
Must be separate from L2 Policer table.

flow_mod_types.name: Green Actions
doc: Green Rule.

flow_mod_types.name: Yellow Actions
doc: Yellow Rule.

flow_mod_types.name: Red Actions
doc: Red Rule.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Default
doc: Built-in rule, no action on a miss, but clear color actions index.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Bridging
doc: L2 switching based on destination MAC and VLAN or Tunnel Id.
MPLS-TP VPLS rules forward based on Tunnel Id and MPLS L2 Port.

flow_mod_types.name: Unicast VPLS Local(UNI)
doc: Switch packet from local(Access) logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

flow_mod_types.name: Multicast VPLS Local(UNI)
doc: Replicate packet from local(Access) logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

flow_mod_types.name: DLF VPLS Local(UNI)
doc: Flood packet from local(Access) logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

flow_mod_types.name: Unicast VPLS E-LAN Network(NNI)
doc: Switch packet from Network logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

flow_mod_types.name: Multicast VPLS Network(NNI)
doc: Replicate packet from Network logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

flow_mod_types.name: DLF VPLS Network(NNI)
doc: Flood packet from Network logical ingress interface in VPLS VSI forwarding domain Tunnel Id.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Default
doc: Default pass through, Policy ACL must forward or packet dropped.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Policy ACL
doc: Match on variety of fields.
Can redirect, drop, meter, copy-to-CONTROLLER, etc.

flow_mod_types.name: IPv6 VLAN
doc: IPv6 - switched/bridged packet including terminated MPLS

flow_mod_types.name: IPv6 MPLS-TP
doc: IPv6 - switched/bridged packet for initiated MPLS

flow_mod_types.name: IPv4 VLAN
doc: IPv4 - switched/bridged packet including terminated MPLS

flow_mod_types.name: IPv4 MPLS-TP
doc: IPv4 - switched/bridged packet for initiated MPLS

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Process the action set.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Egress VLAN
doc: Used for Egress VLAN Translation.
If Ethernet Service OAM MIP or Up MEP then send frame to Egress Maintenance Point.

flow_mod_types.name: VLAN Translate, optional MIP and/or MEP
doc: Final packet can be single tagged or double tagged.
If MIP and/or MEP go to Egress Maintenance Point,
otherwise OUTPUT packet.

flow_mod_types.name: MIP and/or MEP
doc: MIP and/or MEP, go to Egress Maintenance Point

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Continue to next table on miss.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Egress Maintenance Point
doc: Process OAM frame for MIP or Up MEP.
Data frames may be counted and forwarded.

flow_mod_types.name: Up MHF PDU Process (LBM)
doc: Ethernet Service MIP (LBM).
openFlowMpId is of MIP
Drop and send to LOCAL engine.
Could be up to seven levels in theory.

flow_mod_types.name: Up MHF PDU Process (our LTM)
doc: Ethernet Service MIP (LTM).
openFlowMpId is of MIP
Drop and send to LOCAL engine.
Could be up to seven levels in theory.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Process (our MDL)
doc: Process all PDUs at Provider MDL.
openFlowMpId is of Provider MEP
Drop and send to LOCAL engine.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Passthrough (higher MDL)
doc: For Ethernet OAM packets must  be programmed to pass through higher MDL.
Packet forwarded to original OUTPUT port.
openFlowMpId is of Provider MEP in LCK and LM counter.
Could be up to seven levels in theory.

flow_mod_types.name: PDU Drop (lower MDL)
doc: Must be programmed for active filtering. Applies to both MIP and MEP.
Can selectively notify by message, usually just for CCM.
Drop and send to LOCAL engine for optional notification.

flow_mod_types.name: Data Passthough (Provider Up MEP Rx from partner and/or CFM Down MEP TX to partner)
doc: Override default rule for Provider MEP(s).
openFlowMpId is for Provider or CFM MEP(s).
Could be up to seven levels in theory.
Provider Up MEP Rx from partner and/or CFM Down MEP TX to partner

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: There's suppposed to be a MEP or MIP here.
But don't know what to do with this packet, so just forward it.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Egress DSCP PCP Remark
doc: Used for optionally marking QoS fields in VLAN and IP headers.
Marking based on final TRAFFIC_CLASS and COLOR values.

flow_mod_types.name: Remark PCP DSCP (IPv 4)
doc: Remark DSCP (IPv4), PCP, and/or DEI.
Can be used to set S-Tag PCP and DEI for UNI-UNI interoperability.
Ethertype required as prerequisite.

flow_mod_types.name: Remark PCP DSCP (IPv6)
doc: Remark DSCP (IPv6), PCP, and/or DEI.
Can be used to set S-Tag PCP and DEI for UNI-UNI interoperability.
Ethertype required as prerequisite.

flow_mod_types.name: Remark PCP
doc: Remark VLAN PCP, and/or DEI.
Can be used to set S-Tag PCP and DEI for UNI-UNI interoperability.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss
doc: Do not change QoS header field values.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

flow_tables.name: Egress TPID
doc: Used to set the outermost TPID (VLAN tag Ethertype) on tagged packets.

flow_mod_types.name: S-Tag
doc: Make NNI port - set TPID to S-TAG (0x88a8).
Last table in egress pipeline.
Packet must have a VLAN tag.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss tagged
doc: Default is UNI port - set TPID to C-TAG (0x8100).
Last table in egress pipeline.
Only applies to packets with a VLAN tag.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

built_in_flow_mods.name: Table miss untagged
doc: Default untagged - send out port.
Fixed rule, cannot be modified or deleted by controller.

group_entry_types.name: MPLS L2 Replication
doc: Used for specify MPLS VPLS L2 Replication.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:10, SubType [27:24]:0xn, Id [23:16]:0xnn, Tunnel Id [15:0]:0xnnnn(lower 16 bits of mpls_tunnel_id),
Subtype : 0:MPLS L2 Flood, 1:MPLS L2 Multicast, 2:MPLS L2 Local Flood, 3:MPLS L2 Local Multicast

bucket_types.name: Replica
doc: The group entry buckets reference either only local destinations or both local and network destinations

bucket_types.name: Local Replica
doc: The group entry buckets reference only local destinations

group_entry_types.name: MPLS L2 VPN Label
doc: VLAN id and L2 Addresses are set in MPLS Interface group
Drop stats checks for LCK condition.
LM counters used for  PW OAM, Traffic Class supplied by switch
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:9, Sub-Type [27:24]:1, Index [23:0]:0xnnnnnn

group_entry_types.name: MPLS Swap Label Group
doc: LM count used for MPLS-TP LSP or PW
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:9, Sub-Type [27:24]:5, Index [23:0]:0xnnnnnn

group_entry_types.name: MPLS Tunnel Label 1
doc: Used for MPLS LSP.
LM count used for G.8113.1 LSP only.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:9, Sub-Type [27:24]:3, Index [23:0]:0xnnnnnn

group_entry_types.name: MPLS Tunnel label 2
doc: Used to push a third label for certain flows (e.g., ring label).
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:9, Sub-Type [27:24]:4, Index [23:0]:0xnnnnnn

group_entry_types.name: MPLS Fast Failover
doc: Working (1) or protection (0) path bucket.
Next Label depends on specifics of packet flow.
Watch OAM Protection Liveness Logical Port.
Both buckets must chain to the same group entry type.
Naming Convention: Type [31:28]:10, Sub-Type [27:24]:6, Index{23:0]:0xnnnnnn

bucket_types.name: Working(1)
doc: watch : <lport_no>

bucket_types.name: Protection(0)
doc: watch : <lport_no>

group_entry_types.name: MPLS Interface
doc: Used to OUTPUT an MPLS encapsulated packet
LM Count used for Section OAM, Traffic Class supplied by switch.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:9, Sub-Type [27:24]:0

group_entry_types.name: MPLS L2 Tag
doc: TPIDs are the ones allowed in the OpenFlow Spec.
May have other constraints on TPID.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:10, Sub-Type [27:24]:10, Index [23:0]:0xnnnnnn

group_entry_types.name: L2 Interface
doc: Port VLAN filtering enabled, this VLAN allowed.
Implementations can  use to configure egress port VLAN.
VLAN cannot be changed after this group entry.
TUNNEL_ID, MPLS_L2_PORT and DST_NETWORK_ISOLATION_ID are used for split isolation, only VPLS local l2 interface required.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:0, Vlan Id [27:16]:0xnnn, Port [15:0]:0xnnnn

group_entry_types.name: L2 Unfiltered Interface
doc: Port has egress VLAN filtering disabled, any VLAN allowed.
Allow Egress VLAN Translation to change outermost VLAN.
Naming Convention : Type [31:28]:11, Vlan Id [27:16]:0x000, Port [15:0]:0xnnnn

meter_types.name: Color Set Experimenter Meter Type
doc: RFC Standard policer
color is one of: green(0), yellow(1), red(2)
color_aware is one of: Color Blind(0), Color Aware(1)
mode is one of: TrTCM(1), SrTCM(2), Modified TrTCM(4)
color: <color>
color_aware: <color-aware>
mode: <mode>
